questions.text: What is the minimum number of reviewers required for a pull request?

options.explanation: Self-merge bypasses the required review process.
All changes must be reviewed by at least one person who did not author the change.
One independent reviewer is the minimum requirement.
Full team review is not required for every PR.

questions.text: A PR author can approve their own pull request.
questions.explanation: Reviewers must be independent of the author. Self-approval violates the independence requirement.

questions.text: What should a reviewer check during a PR review?

options.explanation: Review scope extends beyond syntax to include correctness, completeness, and compliance.

options.text: Technical accuracy, completeness, and compliance with SOPs
options.explanation: Reviewers verify technical accuracy, completeness of the change, and compliance with applicable procedures.
Compilation is necessary but insufficient — content review is required.
Style preferences are secondary to correctness and compliance.

questions.text: How should review feedback be communicated?

options.explanation: Verbal feedback is not traceable; PR comments create a documented trail.
PR comments provide a documented, traceable record of review feedback and resolution.
Email feedback is not linked to the change and lacks traceability.
Instant messages are not part of the formal review record.

questions.text: A PR can be merged to the main branch before all assigned reviewers have approved.
questions.explanation: All assigned reviewers must approve the PR before it can be merged to maintain document control integrity.
